sentence.Network_en: She looked as if the photographer had caught her by surprise.
sentence.Network_cn: 看上去，她好像被摄影师搞了个猝不及防。

sentence.Network_en: He pounced on the photographer, beat him up and smashed his camera.
sentence.Network_cn: 他突然扑向摄影师，痛打了他一顿，还摔碎了他的照相机。

sentence.Network_en: Grace Robertson started as a photographer with Picture Post in 1947.
sentence.Network_cn: 格雷斯·罗伯逊于1947年参加工作，做了《图片邮报》杂志的一名摄影师。

entry.def: A photographer is someone who takes photographs as a job or hobby.

example.ex: ...a group of TV cameramen and press photographers.
example.tran: 一群电视台的摄影师和报社摄影记者

example.ex: ...a keen amateur photographer with a special interest in natural history subjects.
example.tran: 对博物学题材有特殊兴趣的业余摄影爱好者

sentences.en: a talented photographer who contributed regularly to ‘The Face’
sentences.cn: 定期向“The Face”杂志投稿的天才摄影师

sentences.en: ‘Do you want me to do the job myself or hire a photographer?’ ‘I leave it to your discretion.
sentences.cn: ’“你想让我自己拍摄还是雇个摄影师？”“你自己拿主意吧。”

sentences.en: A photographer had fused the lights,engulfing the entire house darkness.
sentences.cn: 一位摄影师把电灯的保险丝烧断了,使整栋房子陷于黑暗当中。
